title: Measurement Matters - Aspects of Measurement in Women's Health
abstractText:
The seminar series "Measurement Matters: Aspects of measurement in women's health" will bring together a multi-disciplinary and international team of researchers, all with a common interest in women’s health, and provide a platform for exchanging ideas and learning from each other. The series will also provide an opportunity for beneficiaries from the research carried out at the Dugald Baird Centre, Aberdeen to have an input in shaping the course of future research strategy of the unit.

The seminar series will take place as 5 half day mini conferences at the University of Aberdeen and will have the following themes:

  1. The burden of maternal mortality and morbidity;
  2. The use of databases in women's health research;
  3. Evaluation of reproductive health programmes;
  4. The use of audits to improve the quality of care;
  5. A panel discussion involving researchers, policy makers and consumers in determining the research agenda for women’s health.
